content: This is probably the next topic for this stream. Today would have been the meeting to get this planned. Do we need to schedule another?
https://2020.badcamp.org/
Considering BADCamp will be happening before the next regular meeting, I think that will be necessary, especially for https://2020.badcamp.org/summit/backdrop-cms-mini-camp
Well, I think we've been a bit too overwhelmed to schedule an extra meeting. Tomorrow is supposed to be the Design/UX meeting, but I think we will need to highjack it for Badcamp planning.
I was wondering about that earlier today.
I have not been too worried about it, because I think that we have a lot of material ready from Backdrop LIVE that we can use for Badcamp.
It still would have been nice to talk about this sooner, but I'm still catching up on client work after Backdrop LIVE and Open Source Day.
I just haven't had any time.
If we don't want to highjack the Design meeting, we could plan on meeting immediately after the regular DEV meeting to talk about BadCamp
@jenlampton and @klonos - I just attended one of the OSD feedback sessions. Only 4 participants. Nothing too special happened.
But, I think it was good to be there. I'd like to see us do something like this again.
I'm now registered for BADCamp in Hopin. There are currently only 105 people registered for BADCamp in Hopin. I'm thinking this year's event will not be as highly attended as past years.
Is BADCamp happening today?
it's tomorrow here :)
I posted a "complete" schedule on the Mini-Camp page. Please let me know if anyone wants to present on any of these topics! (I signed up for one...)
https://2020.badcamp.org/summit/backdrop-cms-mini-camp
@klonos @StPaulTim @oadaeh (Jason Flatt) @Joseph Flatt
I can talk about contributions and the community, as well as demo the admin UI and showcase UX improvements etc.
I can talk about layouts.
@jenlampton - How is the training looking for tomorrow? Are there folks registering? Do you need more help?
Did I volunteer already and forget?
@jenlampton @StPaulTim @oadaeh (Jason Flatt) are you guys gonna be in the non-profit summit?
I was not planning on attending anything other than Backdrop sessions.
I know that's pretty narrow of me.
You're not narrow @oadaeh (Jason Flatt) ...time/life is "narrow"
...there's like ~75 people in the event btw
...it looks like you needed to register via EventBrite, which I missed to notice ...so looks like I won't be able to join anyway ...I'm not the only one.
Can you not just register right now and then join?
Nope ...the EventBrite page says "sale ended" :sweat:
No worries ...I'll go away and return at 1pm for the Backdrop session :smile:
Hmm, now I'm wondering if I have to register for the training to be available to help.
@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) - I don't think so. I think that @jenlampton can get you in.

StPaulTim said:

oadaeh (Jason Flatt) - I don't think so. I think that jenlampton can get you in.

I'm waiting on that too, I volunteered to help, but I'm not registered for the class.
Yeah, these sessions had a link on their page, asking people to specifically register via EventBrite. See: https://2020.badcamp.org/summit/nonprofit-technology-summit
image.png
...our event doesn't have any such requirement: https://2020.badcamp.org/training/intro-backdrop-cms
image.png
If I recall, we were going to provide our own Zoom room for the training and minicamp. If this is the case, then we can let anyone in that we choose.
That's right @StPaulTim
But, I'm not sure of that. I do know that Jen said we would be using Zoom today and tomorrow.
Well, if it's our Zoom room then we can let anyone in that we choose.
I am confident that the folks from Badcamp are not going to be policing this
...perhaps it would be a good idea to add our zoom room link to the links section in https://2020.badcamp.org/training/intro-backdrop-cms then. Right?
NOpe
Are we just gonna let people know in the Hopin chat then?
I think that Badcamp should make sure that the people who need the link get it. BUT, that as an organization we can bring whoever we need into the room to help.
I don't think we can just share the link publiclly.

@klonos - I don't think it's our responsibility at all to get people to the room. This event is planned and organized by Badcamp and I think we need to leave that to them. But, internally - we can share the link and make sure that we have the people we need there.
That's just my opinion.
:+1:
...I'm fine either way, so long as the job gets done :smile:
I guess I'll go to our usual zoom room, then.
...I'm waiting in the dedicated session Hopin room
@klonos Where is that?
Head to https://app.hopin.to/events/badcamp-2020-trainings-summits/sessions and then select the Backdrop session.
I was under the impression that was just a placeholder.
...I'm waiting there in case anyone shows up and wonders what's going on.
...if we're using our own zoom, then how do people know the link to join?
...are we to provide it, or the BADCamp organizers will do that for us? ...and if so, then how?
There's action in our Zoom room :)
Ah, finally!
I don't think I'm going to come unless I'm needed. too much to do today. Good luck.
@klonos I think registered participants got an email, like I did for a morning session. But I'm not officially registered for this one, I'm volunteering.

If you are here to volunteer for training, go here:
http://bit.ly/backdrop-meetings
I popped in quickly and see that @jenlampton is already there.
Luke has a puzzled expression. :grinning:
It looks like Tim C dropped.
How many people are there?

@klonos @Luke McCormick or @Joseph Flatt - I just sent a private message to Jen suggesting that she make one of you co-host so that you can watch for anyone that get's logged out and let them back in.

I just joined briefly to let Tim C back in. He was locked out and stuck in waiting room. I assume Jen was too busy to notice.
If there is a short break, mention this to her.
Good idea
Will do. :+1:
She's probably ignoring messages.
She looks busy to me.
I interrupted her as she was shifting topics, so we got it handled.
Thanks @oadaeh (Jason Flatt) I couldn't see the chat with the screenshare on :/
Is the session still going on?
...if so, than knock-knock, can someone please let me in? :smile:
The session is over. We ran out of things to talked about, so we decided to end a little early.
Also I seem to be loosing my voice?
I ended up not spending very much time, due to unexpected things happening here.
And now I need to buy a new engine for our Excursion. :frown:
@klonos are you going to be around tomorrow? And are you interested in presenting any of these sections? https://2020.badcamp.org/summit/backdrop-cms-summit
I have a conflict at 11am, I need to be in a meeting with some sharepoint folks. So I need a volunteer to talk about the API site + code documentation (or we can rearrange the schedule a little)
Also, I had some tea + honey and my voice feels ready for tommorow :)
@klonos I think you would be really good at overview + philosophy :)
ok - I'm going to go get some AFK time
thank you @stream @klonos @cellear @oadaeh (Jason Flatt) and @hosef for showing up today! Such a great turnout :)
Sorry, work. ...yes, I can do community intro, mission/philosophy and UI demo.
I think I can cover code differences.

Some things I learned in today's "Introduction to Backdrop" training:

  • You can schedule content to be published at a specified time in the future
  • It includes better handling of phone numbers that let you dial a phone
  • Backdrop can update itself (!)

While defining content types:

  • You can turn off annoying default options
  • You can access the permissions form directly
  • You can define URL alias patterns
  • You can decide whether to display author and date info
  • You can create a node without a path ("Rabbit Hole") that won't display on its own
  • You can schedule comments to disable after a settable period of time.

More things I didn't know, or maybe forgot:

  • You can have it choose to correct image rotation from EXIF data
  • Date in core!
  • I was apparently impressed with manage display - entity view mode, though I don't know what that means.
  • You can float images in Fields display
  • it's awesome to be able to tell them to lazy-load there.
  • The default hero block is actually quite snazzy!
  • You can log in with your email address _or_ your user name.
  • I didn't realize how easy it is to customize the dashboard; I think that's very powerful!
  • Color scheme rocks!
  • You can drag and drop images into WYSIWYG, and it creates file
  • Responsive content edit form
Yeah, as @jenlampton said, some of us have been working with Backdrop for so long that we forget how awesome it is :smile:

...I get asked questions about Drupal as part of my day job (GovCMS App Support Engineer) and very often find myself needing to spin up demo Backdrop sites and Drupal sites side by side, in order to double check that a feature that I have been taking for granted is not Backdrop-only :sweat_smile:
...Backdrop's been spoiling us!

...one of the most notable things I take for granted is Pathauto/Token/Redirect in core ...that was done so early in Backdrop, that I still keep having "What? these aren't in (Drupal) core yet?" moments all the time.
That is part of the reason for what I have been working on for the past few years.
I'm getting a gateway timeout from Zoom.
BADCamp broke Zoom!
I'm finally in.
I don't recognize @StPaulTim clean shaven and with a haircut.

@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) - I got a new drivers license photo taken this week. So, I cleaned myself up a bit.

:-)
Did someone here schedule a Backdrop BOF for today at BADCamp?
Not me. I had hoped to be more involved in Badcamp, but we have visitors and I don't think it's going to happen.
Joseph was informed that one had been planned, but I cannot find a list or any information anywhere about any of the BOFs.
@Luke McCormick - do you know anything about this?
Or @jenlampton?

I finally got a link to a spreadsheet. It was Jen who set it up: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Y17ljCP06PMc4xy4oFPO6Mkbvgn5cQMbe7ZDemkmxpk/edit#gid=0

BADCamp 2020 - Birds of a Feather Sessions (sponsored by Acquia)
Birds of a Feather Schedule Sign up to lead a BoF via Hopin by going to "Expo" > "BADCamp Help Booth" To atttend a BoF, go to "Sessions" in Hopin during the scheduled time. Time Slot,Title,Organizer,Tags,Description Friday 9:00 AM 10:00 AM,JS Components and Hybrid Decoupled,Acquia,Decoupled 10:0...
Man, that BADCamp site is slow.
I don’t know about it.
I guess @jenlampton didn't know about it either? I'm the only one here, but I'm almost 15 minutes late (due to dealing with auto things), so maybe people came and left.
Could it be that someone else outside our group has set that up? (because they wanted to learn more about Backdrop)
I'm pretty sure it was me, but I checked the schedule like 10 times and couldn't find it, so assumed it didn't make the schedule or somethng :( I never saw the google spreadsheet?
@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) I will hopin now and see what is what...
My daughter is having her friend sleep over tonight, so I'm busy with 2 x 9yo's and can't make it.

It's fine. I was there and chatted with a guy named Grant who was at Jen's PDX presentation. Then John Nguyen came in and reset it up (with Jen) for tomorrow, and then we chatted about different things.
Thanks for doing that @oadaeh (Jason Flatt) ++
flatt)** GG (Karma: 2)
...it's almost 2am here, and still haven't managed to get the 2 young ladies to sleep :face_palm: ...they are both hyper.
...I hope to be able to join tomorrow's BoF though.

...it's almost 2am here, and still haven't managed to get the 2 young ladies to sleep :face_palm: ...they are both hyper.

Try adding some vodka to their chocolat milk.
What choco milk? ...no sugary things after 9-10pm. ...but they still find energy :shrug:
...my dad used to tell me stories of their grandma saying that they used to rock babies over gas, to put them out :face_palm:
